result.execSummary:
The defendant James W Goeman II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
First 60 days Straight Time (Jail).  Remaining Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 04-02-2015.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Obtain full time employment with 45 days.  Maintain full time employment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Have medical situation evaluation by AODA or Mental Health Evaluator.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Have medical situation evaluation by AODA or Mental Health Evaluator.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  30 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or the residences listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant James W Goeman in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's name should be amended to James W. Goeman II. Court grants.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
